tr.td: The Java L&F to use in the application. It's recommended to use Nimbus as the application's L&F.
Specifies the name of the connection to use. The name is a basename of the properties file located in the 'connections' directory.
Yes, must be specified either in the properties file or as a command-line argument.

The period in milliseconds between data refresh events. As of Key2Gym 3.0.0, some components (like attendances and items tabs) will refresh the data they display on these events, while others won't. If the value is off, data refresh events will not be fired.

Connections describe how the application should connect to the OpenEJB server. Connections are stored as files in etc/connections/. A connection file's name has the following format: {name}.properties The connection file itself is a
Java-style properties file .
The following is the table of supported properties:

tr.td: The string that is going to displayed in the application as the description of this connection. The value can by any string. Note that you have to escape the Unicode characters. See the properties format description for details.
The URL of the OpenEJB server to connect to.

content.div: The connection to use has to be specified either in the application.properties file or as the command-line argument.

Key2Gym uses Log4J as its logging provider. The logging configuration file is located in etc/logging.properties and is a Log4J logging properties file. You can find the documentation on this file here.
